docs.lead_paragraph: NORMAN C. PAYSON has done it again, almost. Three years ago, he sold Healthsource, his troubled managed health care company, to Cigna for $1.7 billion and personally collected $90 million. Now he is getting industrywide compliments for rescuing an even worse-off company, Oxford Health Plans, the biggest health maintenance organization in the New York region, from a near-death trauma of undigested growth and management problems.

headline.main: Oxford Pays a Price for Its Rebound

docs.abstract: Oxford Health Plans has recovered from losses largely by reducing number of members in units that were unprofitable; Dr Norman C Payson, who was hired as chief executive in 1998, has brought company back from brink of collapse, but so far he has not been able to sell company to large insurer; graph; photo (M)
